subject: Business
title: Influencer Marketing: Trust by Proxy
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Influencer Marketing: Trust by Proxy.

hook.text: A teenager trusts a YouTuber's skincare advice more than a dermatologist's. Parasocial relationships are powerful.

buildup.text: Influencer marketing works because followers feel a personal connection to creators they watch regularly.

discovery.text: Micro-influencers (10Kâ€“100K followers) get higher engagement than celebrities because they feel more relatable.

twist.text: Audiences are getting better at spotting paid partnerships. Inauthentic endorsements now trigger backlash.

climax.text: The shift: from one-off sponsored posts to long-term brand ambassadorships that feel genuine.

punchline.text: Trust can't be bought. But it can be borrowed from someone who earned it.

quiz.question: Why do micro-influencers often outperform celebrities in engagement?
options: They feel more relatable and authentic to their audience
They have better lighting in their photos
